name: Tracy Lee
bio: Tracy is passionate about MVC frameworks and the latest JavaScript technologies. Tracy runs Modern Web podcast & conferences, loves open source, building community, and most of all, cli tools. She helps organize various events in the JS community such as Global Ember Meetup, track chair for QConSF, ng-cruise, and empowers large teams with mentorship through EmberSherpa. You can find more at http://modern-web.org and http://embersherpa.com or follow her on Twitter @ladyleet.
shortBio: Tracy is passionate about MVC frameworks and the latest JavaScript technologies. Tracy runs Modern Web podcast & conferences, loves open source, building community, and most of all, cli tools. She helps organize various events in the JS community such as Global Ember Meetup, track chair for QConSF, ng-cruise, and empowers large teams with mentorship through EmberSherpa. You can find more at http://modern-web.org and http://embersherpa.com or follow her on Twitter @ladyleet.

name: Johan Stokking
bio: Johan is a tech entrepreneur from Amsterdam, The Netherlands. Expertise in event-driven architectures and real-time data processing is applied in products and services in professional sports timing as well as The Things Network that deploys an open, crowd sourced, community-driven, decentralized internet of things data network. This talk will about The Things Network: its foundation, open source vision, technology and why and how we use Golang as our primary language.
shortBio: Johan is a tech entrepreneur from Amsterdam, The Netherlands. Expertise in event-driven architectures and real-time data processing is applied in products and services in professional sports timing as well as The Things Network that deploys an open, crowd sourced, community-driven, decentralized internet of things data network. This talk will about The Things Network: its foundation, open source vision, technology and why and how we use Golang as our primary language.

sessions.title: Go-ing Forward with The Things Network
sessions.description: One year after we launched The Things Network, it has been picked up by more than 250 communities around the world. In this talk, I'll go a bit deeper into specific Go techniques we use to run the system, as well as upstream integrations with Brillo and Weave.

name: Abraham Haskins
bio: I'm an engineer for Firebase at Google and has been a Firebase developer for a long time. Prior to joining the team at Google I ran a Firebase-focused consulting company. I spend my days working with people who build great things on Firebase and building open-source Firebase tooling to help them.
shortBio: I'm an engineer for Firebase at Google and has been a Firebase developer for a long time. Prior to joining the team at Google I ran a Firebase-focused consulting company. I spend my days working with people who build great things on Firebase and building open-source Firebase tooling to help them.

name: Dylan Drost
bio: Android Developer for 4,5 years. I work at Karify where we are building an online healthcare platform to help treat and manage patients in Mental health institutions. I work on the Android app and helped build the REST Api for the platform. Before I joined Karify I worked at Pixplicity on different large and small App projects. Beside making awesome Apps I help manage the technical part of the food blog Betty’s Kitchen which is run by my wife

I work on the Android app and helped build the REST Api for the platform. Before I joined Karify I worked at Pixplicity on different large and small App projects. Beside making awesome Apps I help manage the technical part of the food blog Betty’s Kitchen which is run by my wife.

name: Mete Atamel
bio: I'm a Developer Advocate at Google, currently focused on helping developers with Google Cloud Platform. Prior to Google, I worked as a Software Engineer at Microsoft, Skype, Adobe, EMC, and Nokia building apps and services using various web, mobile and cloud technologies.
shortBio: I'm a Developer Advocate at Google, currently focused on helping developers with Google Cloud Platform. Prior to Google, I worked as a Software Engineer at Microsoft, Skype, Adobe, EMC, and Nokia building apps and services using various web, mobile and cloud technologies.

name: Maurice de Beijer
bio: Maurice de Beijer is an independent software consultant and trainer. He specializes in JavaScript, React, AngularJS and ASP.NET MVC. His work includes a large, global, safety application for the oil and gas industry. Maurice is also active in the open source community. He teaches ECMAScript, TypeScript, React, Angular JS and ASP.NET MVC courses. Since 2005, he has received Microsoft’s Yearly Most Valuable Professional Award. Further, Maurice is active in the Dutch dotNED user group and helps organize its meetings
